articles.title: All eyes on approaching Fed meet, yen slips further
articles.description: The yen remained under pressure on Tuesday and the Australian dollar was bruised by the latest lockdowns in China following new COVID-19 outbreaks, but moves were more muted than in recent days as traders eyes turned to this week's Fed meeting.

articles.title: Gold eases as yields surge ahead of Fed meeting
articles.description: Gold prices fell on Tuesday to their lowest in more than a week, as U.S. Treasury yields surged ahead of an expected rate hike from the Federal Reserve, and as hopes for progress in Russia-Ukraine talks further dampened the metal's safe-haven appeal.

articles.title: दिल्ली में 33 डिग्री सेल्सियस पहुंचा तापमान, दो दिनों में और होगा इजाफा
articles.description: दिल्ली में तापमान 33 डिग्री पहुंच गया है। स्काईमेट के अनुसार, इस हफ्ते दिन के तापमान में बढ़ोतरी जारी रहेगी। अगले दो दिनों में मध्यम सतही हवाएं अचानक वृद्धि को रोक सकती हैं।

articles.title: Bank of England likely to lift Bank Rate on Thursday
articles.description: The Monetary Policy Committee will add another 25 basis points to Bank Rate this week, taking it to 0.75% - its pre-pandemic level - according to 44 of 49 economists polled by Reuters March 10-14. The other five said there would be no change.

articles.title: China reports record 5,280 daily Covid cases
articles.description: The record figure was driven by a surge in nationwide Omicron outbreaks, with over 3,000 domestic transmissions in the northeastern province of Jilin, according to NHC data.

articles.title: यूपी चुनाव में 62 सीटों पर कांग्रेस से ज्यादा मिले नोटा को वोट, 6 लाख से ज्यादा वोटर्स को नहीं भाया कोई प्रत्याशी
articles.description: उत्तर प्रदेश विधानसभा चुनाव में 6 लाख 37 हजार 331 लोगों ने नोटा का विकल्प चुना था। 62 सीटों पर नोटा को कांग्रेस से ज्यादा वोट मिले हैं। वहीं, नोटा का वोट प्रतिशत एआईएमआईएम, जेडीयू, सीपीआई से भी ज्यादा है।

articles.title: Berkshire Hathaway stock price hits $500,000-mark for first time

articles.author: TNN
articles.title: K'taka: SSLC teachers owe Rs 41L for errors
articles.description: During the SSLC exams in July 2020, 4,317 teachers committed mistakes in evaluation which resulted in students seeking revaluation. In all cases, a minimum of six marks varied after revaluation and was up to 20 marks in some cases.
